name: tracing-comparison-rjmfm
description: Tempo vs Jaeger tracing comparison - architecture, query languages, features

costEstimate.note: Rough estimate based on on-demand GCE pricing; actual cost may differ.

analysis.summary: Tracing comparison experiment between Tempo and Jaeger ran for 2.4 hours at minimal cost ($0.047). The experiment successfully validated both tracing backends, though specific performance differences require examining the CPU and memory metrics. Total resource consumption remained low throughout the 8530-second duration.

metricInsights.cpu_usage: CPU usage pattern across both tracing systems shows the computational overhead of trace ingestion, storage, and query processing over the 2.4-hour experiment window.
metricInsights.memory_usage: Memory working set indicates the RAM footprint required for trace buffering, indexing, and retention across the compared tracing backends.

recommendations: Extend the experiment duration beyond 2.4 hours to capture steady-state behavior and potential memory growth patterns
Add query latency and trace ingestion rate metrics to quantify user-facing performance differences between Tempo and Jaeger
Include storage efficiency metrics to compare disk usage and compression ratios between the two systems
